newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria lev ends softer on mark, firms vs dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria lev ends softer on mark, firms vs dollar.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev closed at 998-999 per mark on Tuesday, down from 996-998 at the opening and 996 at Monday's close, traders said.
Trade was active throughout the day as banks sought marks on their own behalf to profit on higher foreign currency interbank deposit rates and on behalf of clients.
Interbank overnight lev depo rates now stand at 1.50-1.75 percent annually against 3.0 percent on overnight mark deposits.
The lev closed at 1,825-1,829 to the dollar, firmer from 1,829-1,831 at the opening and 1,840-1,843 at Monday's close as the mark recovered against the dollar on global markets.
Local traders adjust the lev/dollar to the lev/mark and the international mark/dollar crosses.
The lev has been pegged at 1,000 to the mark as an anchor in an IMF-prescribed currency board system, a fixed exchange rate mechanism introduced on July 1 to restore confidence in the lev.
Under the system Bulgaria's central bank pledged to buy and sell unlimited volumes of the anchor currency at a fixed bid of 995 levs and ask of 1,000. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 91188
